Alexandria.Wilbur J. Cohen Federal Building:
Wilbur J. Cohen Federal Building (formerly the Social Security Administration Building) is an historic building at 330 Independence Avenue, Southwest, Washington, D.C.


== History ==
It was designed by Charles Klauder and Louis A. Simon, in the Stripped Classical style in 1939. On April 28, 1988, it was renamed the "Wilbur J. Cohen Federal Building." On July 6, 2007, the Social Security Administration Building was added to the National Register of Historic Places. Voice of America and the Broadcasting Board of Governors are the building's main tenants.
